item.title: sharing music
item.description:
i inked in faded words on the cut up stickers stuck to the back of my phone, hiding the embarrasing past behind them.

today i looked at the back of my phone, the ink had rubbed off. must be in my pants pocket, or floating around town, all physical information about that night spread out in oxford’s chilly pollution. that’s what time does - delocalizes coherent initial information.

maybe if you can make a rough sketch of who you were at different discrete points, the right person can interpolate through, and find you at the end of the graph.

item.title: identity
item.description:
the past is difficult. identity is the accumulation of the past, so it’s even more difficult.

what’s the balance we should strike between feeling ourselves in the moment, and understanding how what we’ve seen and done brought us to where we are? maybe i’m afraid of remembering because i don’t want it to limit what could happen next. i probably have some weird notion that the function of our lives has to be everywhere continuous, the existence of a past constrains the future. i don’t want to remember my successes in case they lead me to languish, i don’t want to remember my failures in case they convince me not to try and fail again.

you can prove that identical particles cannot be distinguished by their histories. well, why shouldn’t that apply to everything, after all?

i want to be interested in everything, don’t you?

i want to fill my life up with myself!

item.title: Four Portraits
item.description: these are portraits of four of my friends i met in georgia on an island. elena stole an orange from someone’s yard. she had to work up her courage to do it and came up with all these justifying reasons but turns out the orange wasnt ripe. she tried to eat it anyway but couldnt and threw it away.
